metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4168 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
(1) iodined.c and (2) user.c in iodine before 0.7.0 allows remote attackers to bypass authentication by continuing execution after an error has been triggering.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

iodine - 0.6.0~rc1-19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: iodine package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.0~rc1-19').
